citeinfo.origin: Fisheries and Oceans Canada - Ocean Science And Productivity, Pacific
citeinfo.title: Ship of Opportunity: Canada to Japan - 1980-present

descript.abstract: Data from merchant ships travelling between British Columbia and Japan, from 1980-1990 (Canada Ace), 1995 to 2000, continuing (Skaugran), and 1999-2000, continuing (Alligator Hope). Data collected include surface total carbon dioxide, alkalinity, nutrients, chlorophyll a, carbon-13 in seawater, and atmospheric carbon-13. Underway measurements include position, time, temperature and salinity. Skaugran samples and data were collected 3-4 times daily by scientific staff and once daily by ship`s engineers until 1999, then were reduced to daily engineer`s samples. Alligator Hope samples were collected 3 times daily.
descript.purpose: Constructing models of North Pacific carbon cycling; air-sea exchange, monitoring long term changes in the North Pacific Ocean, tracking water masses in the ocean, El Nino monitoring
descript.supplinf: Risk Justification: Custodian will be leaving soon and has a large quantity of data not secured in a regional data centre. Risk of Loss: High Impact Justification: Time series of 5 to 10 years Impact of Loss: Medium Recommended Action: Obtain access to data, bring data to archives

place.placekey: South Inner Coast (Johnstone, Georgia, JDF, inlets and passages)
North Inner Coast (QCS, Hecate, Dixon Inlet and passages)

idinfo.useconst: Collaborative data with Japanese scientists. The less recent data will be released after publication, with permission of the collaborators. Alkalinity and TCO2 data from the Canadian Ace have been sent to OSAP archives.

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

dataqual.logic: Interlaboratory comparisons of nutrient and carbon-13 and oxygen-18 measurements; comparison to known standards. Salinometer calibrated with standard seawater. Fluorometer calibrated with commercially prepared standard. Data are plotted to detect outlyers.
dataqual.complete: Dataset Complications: Some CTD data from the Alligator Hope are questionable. Chlorophyll data may be questionable. Canada Ace data are of unknown quality, and therefore will not be released. No data collected 1991-1994. For some programs, fewer parameters were measured. Electronic Data Complications: Magnetic tapes are older than their guaranteed physical lifespan.

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

stdorder.nondig: Hardcopy Original Exists: Y Hardcopy Locations: Keith Johnson, Rm 2404, IOS, and Rm 1421 Hardcopy Description: Binders of log sheets from the samplers aboard ship. Hardcopy Volume: About 2 4-foot shelves of 3 in. binders Hardcopy Complications: N/A Physical Sample Exists: Y Physical Sample Locations: Coolers, Hangar Bldg, IOS Physical Sample Volume: 2300 carbon-13 samples and unknown number of O-18 samples Physical Sample Description: Carbon-13 samples: 2300 s Oxygen-18 samples: unknown amt. Physical Sample Complications: Samples need to be kept refrigerated.
stdorder.ordering: Contact data custodian before data are sent to the IOS archive.

offoptn.offmedia: Computer hard drive, VMS network hard drive, zip drives, PC network drives

stdorder.ordering: Electronic Data Doc Locations: Header fields in each file. Dataset Locations: Shared Chemistry drive, IOS, computer in Rm XXXX.

distinfo.techpreq: Backup by Custodian: Y Backup by Automation: Y Backup Description: Magnetic tape ascii data files always saved to 3 mirror image tapes. VAX account backup saved to 1 tape. Most data on tapes are no longer current version. Some magnetic tapes were sent to Vancouver tape archive some years ago.
